content.raw: To link against ignition physics classes, we could use the [doxygen keyword `\ref`](http://www.doxygen.nl/manual/commands.html#cmdref). This would create a relative link that works locally as well as on ignitionrobotics.org. It will also mean we won't have to update it when we release ign-physics 3. So, for example, the syntax for `Features` and `FeatureLists` would be `\ref ignition::physics::Feature "Features"` and `\ref ignition::physics::FeatureList "FeatureLists"`. Alternatively, you can just use the namespaced name of the class (eg. `ignition::physics::Feature`) and doxygen will automatically generate a link.
content.html: To link against ignition physics classes, we could use the doxygen keyword \ref. This would create a relative link that works locally as well as on ignitionrobotics.org. It will also mean we won't have to update it when we release ign-physics 3. So, for example, the syntax for Features and FeatureLists would be \ref ignition::physics::Feature "Features" and \ref ignition::physics::FeatureList "FeatureLists". Alternatively, you can just use the namespaced name of the class (eg. ignition::physics::Feature) and doxygen will automatically generate a link.
